title: If an environment's view's bin folder is in the user's PATH variable while the environment is not active, `spack env activate <name> && spack env deactivate` will remove it.

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
If an environment's view's bin folder is in the user's PATH variable while the environment is not active, `spack env activate <name> && spack env deactivate` will remove it.

My use case: I have a set of development tools I have installed via spack in an environment with a view in my home directory. If I need to add a new tool, I'll activate the environment, install the tool, and then deactivate it. Unfortunately, this also removes the directory to the view's bin dir from my PATH.

I don't want to activate the environment in my profile because 1) it can be slow, and 2) I may be using another environment.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack env create --with-view $HOME/foo-view foo
$ export PATH=$HOME/foo-view/bin:$PATH
$ spack env activate foo
$ spack env deactivate
$ echo $PATH
# Observe that $HOME/foo-view/bin is no longer in $PATH
...
```

### Error Message
N/A

### Information on your system

* **Spack:** 0.14.2
* **Python:** 3.7.7
* **Platform:** darwin-catalina-skylake

### Additional information

- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [x] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output (No failing commands)
